revised_title: Changes in Pepsin-Forming Glands During Secretion
tldr: The authors investigate the changes in pepsin-forming glands during the secretion process, focusing on the granular state and the role of granules in the formation of the proteid ferment. They observe and describe the changes in various animal species, including frogs, newts, and fish, and discuss the differences between chief-cells and border-cells in the fresh state.
